title: Strengthening the Reliability and Security of the United States Electric Grid
summary:
The document is Executive Order 14262, issued on April 8, 2025, aimed at strengthening the reliability and security of the United States electric grid. It addresses the significant strain on the electric grid due to rising electricity demand, driven by technological advancements and increased domestic manufacturing. The order emphasizes the need for a reliable energy supply to maintain national and economic security.

Key policies outlined include ensuring the resilience of the electric power grid and utilizing all available power generation resources, especially secure and redundant fuel supplies. The Secretary of Energy is tasked with streamlining processes to prevent grid failures and developing a methodology to analyze reserve margins across regions. This includes identifying and retaining critical generation resources in at-risk regions to maintain system reliability.

The order also states that its implementation will be consistent with applicable laws and does not create enforceable rights against the United States or its entities. Overall, the executive order highlights the urgency of addressing energy reliability to support technological innovation and safeguard national interests.
